CN.content:

2. side-chain D-A polymers (specific type of polymer)

Sure! Here are the Material Name entities in the paragraph:

So, the Material Name entities in the paragraph are:

Sure! Here are the relevant entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties:

2. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)

These are the only entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to material properties.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: As a result of these merits , PSCs based on these previously reported side - chain D-A polymers exhibited a maximal PCE of 4.74% .

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following entities can be identified as "Property Value" entities:

1. PCE (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency) - The percentage of sunlight converted into electrical energy by the solar cell.
2. 4.74% - The value of the PCE mentioned in the paragraph, which is the maximum efficiency achieved by the PSCs based on the side-chain D-A polymers.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, my apologies for including irrelevant entities in my previous response. Here are the entities that clearly refer to the value of material properties in the given paragraph:

1. PCE (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency) - The percentage of sunlight converted into electrical energy by the solar cell.
2. 4.74% - The value of the PCE mentioned in the paragraph, which is the maximum efficiency achieved by the PSCs based on the side-chain D-A polymers.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to the value of material properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| PCE (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency) | 4.74% |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
